result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Hearing on December 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.

1:18 PM Defendant Xavier D Broomfield in court.  Attorney Jessica A Klein in court for Xavier D Broomfield.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Nesheim in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

The Court goes over the procedural history of the case.
The State gives its bail recommendation.
The Defense gives its bail recommendation.
The Court quashes the warrant.
Hearing scheduled for December 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Signed by Judge Carter on 10/31/2022.
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of $500.00

10:28 AM Defendant Xavier D Broomfield not in court.  Attorney Jessica A Klein in court for Xavier D Broomfield. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Jack Rieder. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Defense does not know why the Defendant does not appear today. Defense has not had recent communication with the Defendant. 

State motions the Court to issue a warrant for the defendant and to revoke and forfeit any bail. Court orders same. 11/15/2022 jury trial is cancelled.
